content: rastatastic by susan ashcroft yarn malabrigo rasta or similar be sure to check gauge rasta is rated super bulky with 82meters/150g the hat takes less than 1 skein so you ll probably enough left for a pompom if you like suggested needle size 9mm for main section 6 5mm for rib but the most important thing is gauge be sure you are getting the correct gauge or your hat will end up bigger or smaller gauge 9sts per 10cm/4 - approx 17 row but row gauge is not critical size approx 55cm/22 malabrigo rasta on 9mm knitting in the round use your favourite technique for the crown - 2 circulars magic loop or double-pointed needles supplies one stitch marker abbreviations k = knit p = purl st s = stitch es k2tog = knit 2 sts together k3tog = knit 3 sts together sl = slip st purlwise with yarn in front you can find more yarn ideas and projects linked to the pattern page on ravelry - link © ashcroft-hempsall 2019 - for personal non-commercial use only rastatastic 2 making the hat cast on 48 sts using the smaller needle and cable cast-on link for cable cast-on http //stitchnerd blogspot be/2011/10/cable-cast-on html usually we use only one size smaller for rib but because the slipped stitches will be tighter than stockinette it s best to use several sizes smaller for the rib on this hat but be sure to check it will fit tips tip 1 take care not to twist your stitches when joining - check again when you start round 2 because if you do have a twist you can still untwist then tip 2 try on your hat after a few rounds to check the fit work the first row of rib and then place a marker and join to work in the round rib *k2 p1 repeat from * to end of the round work 5-6 row of rib approx 3 5cm/1½ of rib then switch to the larger needle and work as follows note slip all sl stitches with the yarn in front to create strands across the fabric main section round 1 *sl1 k1 repeat from * to end of the round round 2 knit to the end of the round round 3 *k1 sl1 repeat from * to end of the round round 4 knit to the end of the round for a beanie repeat these 4 rounds until the hat measures approx 11-12 cm 4½ - 5½ from the cast-on edge stopping after round 1 or round 3 then work the crown using the correct column from the table below option you can add more height before starting the crown if you wish repeat each instruction to the end of the round if you stopped after round 1 if you stopped after round 3 c2 1 *k5 k3tog 36 sts c4 1 *k5 k3tog 36 sts c2 2 *k1 sl1 c4 2 *sl k1 c2 3 knit all sts c4 3
